meanings.definition: In a state of excitement or liveliness.
meanings.sent1: The children were abubble with joy at the sight of the ice cream truck.
meanings.sent2: The party was abubble with laughter and music.
meanings.sent3: The classroom was abubble with energy as the students prepared for the school play.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was abubble with creative ideas for the art project.
meanings.sent5: The city streets were abubble with activity during the festival.

meanings.sent1: The pot on the stove was abubble with hot soup.
meanings.sent2: The cauldron was abubble with a magical potion.
meanings.sent3: The lake was abubble with fish jumping out of the water.
meanings.sent4: The volcano was abubble with molten lava ready to erupt.
meanings.sent5: The tea kettle was abubble with steam as it whistled.
